Student group invested in arms company

By Joseph Silke

The Griff Fund, a group of York students which manages part of the University's endowment fund, is invested in defence giant Lockheed Martin.

By Patrick Walker

Students were left waiting for upwards of an hour for coats and other belongings

Revealed: York's crisis of mental healthcare

By Patrick Walker

Open Door is popular but delivered mixed results. Better, and more widespread academic mental health training is needed.

York to remain affiliated with the NUS

By Joseph Silke

York students decide to remain part of the organisation with 60.1 per cent voting to stay affiliated. The decision means YUSU is expected to stay in the NUS until at least 2022 on turnout of 1017 votes, passing quorum by 43 votes.

By Joseph Silke

EU citizens in York denied a vote yesterday

By Joseph Silke

A national trend emerged yesterday of EU citizens being turned away at polling stations for the European elections. We spoke to people in York who were denied their vote.

"Utter mayhem" at Law exam as staff mishandle the exam papers

By Joseph Silke

Law students are outraged after mistakes by University staff at today's exam on EU law left many students without correct exam papers. There have also been claims that students with the correct papers were given an unfair advantage.

Referendum on NUS affiliation to take place in Week Eight this term

By Joseph Silke

After conducting a consultation with students about YUSU's relationship with the organisation, students will get their say on whether to 'Remain' or 'Leave'.

By Joseph Silke

The society, which was officially ratified by YUSU in autumn, "reluctantly" removed the term from their event, but say they "stand by the use of the word".
